page.title: 06Noah's Ark Farm
page.content: Our block is 56% rural and 44% residential. Noah's Ark farm is a typical small farm in our block. The farm we visited had 35 acres. They keep 60 beef cows and sell them after twelve months. On most farms the busiest time is June and July with hay making. They have three stages of hay making, cutting, tedding and baling. In our block there are nineteen different farms. Their animals eat 15,000 bales a year. They are highly mechanized with two tractors, a tedder, a baler, a sowing machine and a cutter. When they first get their calves at a week old they disbud their horns by burning them out completely. They used to keep 30 milk cows but it was too much work with the milking in the evening and in the morning.
